channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Villar Group turns over PhilSports Arena to Medical Corps
item.description: Medical personnel from the Philippine National Police will oversee and lead operations at Philippine Sports Arena or ULTRA (University of Life Training and Recreational Arena) “We Heal As One” Center.

item.title: Concepcion extends Go Negosyo Project ARK rollout
item.description: Presidential adviser for entrepreneurship and Go Negosyo founder Joey Concepcion has confirmed that more local government units in Metro Manila and nearby provinces will join the Project ARK initiative.

item.title: Meralco rates lower this month
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: Manila Electric Co. announced yesterday its customers would see lower electricity bills this month due to lower generation charge, after the power distributor invoked force majeure claims.

item.title: NTC: Free speech, affected employee were considered
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: In ordering the closure of broadcast giant ABS-CBN, the National Telecommunications Commission said it considered the issue of freedom of speech and expression as well as the number of employees that would be adversely affected by the decision.

item.title: For COVID, MVP Group advances tax payments
item.author: Iris Gonzales
item.description: Manuel V. Pangilinan said his group is committed to continue helping the government respond to the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis in the country, including boosting the administration’s war chest by advancing his conglomerate’s tax payments.

item.title: Churches to accept weddings
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: The Archdiocese of Manila will start accepting weddings once the enhanced community quarantine in Metro Manila is lifted, but will prohibit lavish weddings in all churches under its jurisdiction once Metro Manila shifts to general community quarantine due to the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Private schools eye early opening
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Some private schools may start classes ahead of the Aug. 24 schedule set by the Department of Education for public elementary and high schools.

item.title: Alan Peter blames NTC, vows to fix ABS-CBN mess
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: Speaker Alan Peter Cayetano yesterday vowed to “fix the mess” spawned by the closure of broadcast giant ABS-CBN by the National Telecommunications Commission.

item.title: Metro mayors to meet on quarantine options
item.author: Ralph Edwin Villanueva
item.description: Metro Manila mayors will meet again today via video conference to finalize details on what to recommend to authorities – whether to extend or downgrade the enhanced community quarantin in the metropolis to curb the spread of coronavirus disease 2019?

item.title: Medical frontliners with COVID-19 in Philippines rise to 1,934
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Medical frontliners account for 18.48% of the country’s confirmed COVID-19 cases or about one health worker for every five infected individuals.
